meanings.definition: The act of composing again or differently.
meanings.sent1: After the concert, the musician started the recomposition of his latest song.
meanings.sent2: The artist's recomposition of the painting gave it a fresh and modern look.
meanings.sent3: The recomposition of the puzzle made it even more challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her recomposition of the traditional dance added a unique twist to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The recomposition of the ingredients created a new and delicious dish.

meanings.definition: A piece of music that has been rearranged or reworked.
meanings.sent1: The orchestra performed a beautiful recomposition of a classic symphony.
meanings.sent2: The recomposition of the song gave it a more upbeat and lively tempo.
meanings.sent3: Listening to the recomposition of the familiar melody brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The recomposition of the old jazz tune added a modern twist to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The recomposition of the musical piece showcased the composer's creativity.

meanings.definition: The process of breaking down and rebuilding organic matter in the environment.
meanings.sent1: The recomposition of the soil by earthworms helps enrich it with nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The gardeners studied the recomposition of compost to improve plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The scientist explained the importance of recomposition in maintaining a healthy ecosystem.
meanings.sent4: The natural process of recomposition plays a vital role in nutrient cycling.
meanings.sent5: The farmer observed the gradual recomposition of organic matter in the field.
